alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 16 at 4:51AM AKDT until September 17 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Kuskokwim Bay. Highest water levels will be from the Kuskokwim River mouth and to the northwest. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise 5 to 8 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...From this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Low lying areas could flood. Some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion could occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A powerful low pressure system in the Western Bering this morning will move northeast towards St. Lawrence Island through Saturday morning. As it moves north, northwesterly winds will increase through the day today. The combination of strong winds and fetch will produce a storm surge along the coast, leading to coastal flooding and the potential for coastal erosion along the Kuskokwim Delta coast.
info.instruction: A coastal flood warning means that flooding is occurring or imminent. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.
